post.name: What are some items that really aren't worth paying the expensive version for?
post.body: I saw [this](https://lemmy.world/post/10314727) post and wanted to ask the opposite. What are some items that really aren't worth paying the expensive version for? Preferably more extreme or unexpected examples.

creator.name: kzhe
creator.bio: FOSS enthusiast, Linux user, Android enthusiast, Transformers fan (he/him)

community.name: asklemmy
community.title: Asklemmy
community.description:
A loosely moderated place to ask open-ended questions

**[Search asklemmy](https://lemmy.ml/search?q=&type=Posts&listingType=All&communityId=8&page=1&sort=TopAll) üîç**

If your post meets the following criteria, it's welcome here!

1. Open-ended question
2. Not offensive: at this point, we do not have the bandwidth to moderate overtly political discussions. Assume best intent and be excellent to each other.
3. **Not regarding using or support for Lemmy**: [context](https://lemmy.ml/post/1223478), see the list of support communities and tools for finding communities below
4. Not ad nauseam inducing: please make sure it is a question that would be new to most members
5. [An actual topic of discussion](https://lemmy.ml/post/1239589)

Looking for support? 

* [!lemmy_support@lemmy.ml](https://lemmy.ml/c/lemmy_support) 
* [!fediverse@lemmy.ml](https://lemmy.ml/c/fediverse) 
* [!selfhosted@lemmy.world](https://lemmy.world/c/selfhosted) 

Looking for a community? 

* [Lemmyverse](https://lemmyverse.net/communities): community search 
* [sub.rehab](https://sub.rehab/): maps old subreddits to fediverse options, marks official as such 
* [!lemmy411@lemmy.ca](https://lemmy.ca/c/lemmy411): a community for finding communities 

~Icon~ ~by~ ~@Double_A@discuss.tchncs.de~
